website_summaries.verdict: A nicer budget model that cooks faster than others.
pros: Users love the DuraCeramic nonstick coating on the plates, making waffles easy to release
Designed to cook faster, saving time and energy
The polished chrome exterior looks great on your counter

customer_reviews.title: MUST BUY ! THIS IS THE BEST
customer_reviews.text: MUST BUY ! This is one of the best Waffle Maker I had ever owned. And even I am using it in Singapore (yes, with a power transformer) it makes the effort worthwhile as it makes the best waffle. We have a situation in which the temperature control is imperative to our use. My spouse likes white color waffle, my mother like it medium and for me, I like it crispy. So, its a one maker for all happiness. The non-stick surface is also great, and with little oil for first use, it works well. Would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Tin

customer_reviews.title: Lovr the ceramic!
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a waffle iron years ago that was coated with that awful non stick surface and I threw it away bc if the chemical smell when I made waffles and how hard it was to clean. I recently decided I wanted one again so indecided to look and I was thrilled to find this inexpensive, ceramic one. It really is non stick and no chemical smell bc no teflon coating. Wipes clean easily and makes delicious waffles. Easy to use and the settings give you soft or nice crisp waffles. I read the reviews and I'm glad I ignored the few bad reviews. This is a great waffle iron! I've used it about 5 times now.
customer_reviews.author: Kitnknit

customer_reviews.title: If it doesn't work, it is NOT the fault of this waffle maker!
customer_reviews.text: This waffle maker works just great! You don't need to spray oil on it, it is easy to clean and the waffles look and taste wonderful! I was a little bit worried, when I read some of the bad reviews (some even with photos), but I think some people just can't cook or bake.
customer_reviews.author: Watzfrau

customer_reviews.title: Good company’s don’t hide their phone number and make you stay on the phone for over an hour
customer_reviews.text: The worst product experience I’ve ever had! I gave this waffle iron far too many chances. The batter sucks to the iron, about 70% of time. I’ve been trying to reach customer service for over an hour and a half now. One 30 minute wait, the second an hour. No answer. It worked fine once, second time stuck to the waffle iron, it went back and forth like this for the last 4-5 months of owning it. We followed instructions, we tried different methods, we really wanted our product to work out. But my patience is worn. I’ve burned myself too many times trying to get the waffle unstuck. Grrrr. NEVER BUYING FROM OYSTER AGAIN!!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D. Wright

customer_reviews.title: It looks nice but the plates are not removable for washing and ...
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice but the plates are not removable for washing and it doesn't cook waffles very well. I set it on high (MAX) for well done waffles and when the green light went on the waffle was not done, not even to a medium. The waffle was still all white and mushy not even browned, I had to leave it in for two more cycles to get it to even brown the top of the waffle. Considering asking for a return.
customer_reviews.author: deddy

customer_reviews.title: It lasted less than 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to have ceramic waffle maker and it worked well when I got at first. I didn't have any problem till today. I didn't use any metal or sharp object and did cleaning with cloths and paper towel as advised. When I tried to make waffle today, the batter sticked at the bottom and I wasn't be able to remove till it cooled. Now it is useless. It has black marks at the bottom and I can not remove them without using a knife or any metal which will scratch the ceramic coating. Long story short I wouldn't recommend this to anyone. I should have gone for more expensive and sturdy one...
customer_reviews.author: Selcuk Karahan

customer_reviews.title: Love the waffle iron!
customer_reviews.text: I bought waffle iron because it was the only one I found made from titanium. I've used it multiple times to make paleo waffles. It heats up quickly, is easy to use, and cleans up easily.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: makes a healthy (non oily) waffle!
customer_reviews.text: used it several times and so far, i really like it! the ceramic coating doesn't require any oil- i think its discouraged because it can leave a sticky film that will make it nonstick and harder to clean as time goes by. so by default- it makes healthier waffles made savory as well as regular protein waffles- makes a nice crust. easy to clean- i use a damp paper towel and wipe down with silicone tongs while still hot, makes it super easy to clean and safe (with tongs) i batch cook ( about 6 waffles) , freeze and pop into toaster for a quick and yummy snack that tastes fresh!
customer_reviews.author: cookiemonster

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang for your Buck
customer_reviews.text: I had a old waffle maker that needed replaced so I started looking at a bunch of waffle makers. I found some that were well over $60 and just decided to give this one a go. I have been very impressed with it! It is so easy to clean. The waffles do not stick, it cooks evenly, and heats up very quickly! I like my waffles a little more crisp so I leave them in a little longer than when the light signals that it is ready. I doubt the $60 ones are any better than this. I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: This item is being returned. I do not know if the waffle iron is defective, or if it is functioning correctly, but it took 15 minutes to cook a waffle. The bottom of the waffle was really crisp while the top was barely done. I currently have Oster appliances and have had them in the past; this is the first one that has not worked.
customer_reviews.author: Quality buyer

customer_reviews.title: Damn! This is a good Waffle maker.
customer_reviews.text: Damn! My daughter will not get up early but she got up early to make waffles with this Waffle maker. If I leave it up to her, she will make waffles every day. The waffle maker is sturdy; the waffles come out clean; it’s a good machine. In short I would recommend this waffle maker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great waffles
customer_reviews.text: I love this waffle maker. Right size and right price. Waffles come out very good and it is easy to clean. I set mine on the highest setting as I like crispy waffles. Once you figure out how much batter to use, there is no overflow. I started slowly with not complete waffles, and now I make the perfect waffle. I highly recommend this unit for use by one or two people in the family. Waffles are about 7 or 8 inches in diameter.
customer_reviews.author: VG

customer_reviews.title: Jessie’s thumbs down, avoid, chewy, and Nasty
customer_reviews.text: This thing does not get waffles crispy, Even tried cornstarch, flour and peanut oil! that’s a guarantee crispy. not on this thing this is more like a steamer! Guarantee soft and chewy, Reference to like bubble gum. If you like crispy only get cast iron waffles makers! This is my second mistake tried aluminum and titanium. Back to cast iron guaranteed soft inside and crispy shell! Only buying products which I know now, may cost a little more but worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie S

customer_reviews.title: Great waffles every time!
customer_reviews.text: Been using for several months---what a pleasure! The ceramic coating works SOO much better than traditional non-stick coatings! Takes a little trial and error to find out exactly where to set the dial to get the right doneness for you (hint: after you figure it out, mark the spot with a permanent magic marker, so if the dial gets move you can easily set it back to the correct spot)
customer_reviews.author: Mixman

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, best for one or two people
customer_reviews.text: I had a waffle maker I bought 40 years ago. I was still working but had a non-stick plastic on the griddle which might harm my two parrots. The old one made "4 waffle sections" which meant I had to freeze half every time I made waffles. The smaller Oster is more suited to my needs and is safe for my two birds. At under $18 it's a good buy, too. Oh, and it takes up less space than my old one did.
customer_reviews.author: Jacques Laroque

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I love how quick and how well this cooks my food and I use it for everything. I use it for bacon, I use it for eggs, I use it for grilling shrimp...it is so versatile and to clean it, I just turned it on its side in my sink and spray it down with hot water. The griddle surfaces are made out of ceramic and so the food does not stick. It's been holding up and I love this so much...it's great for someone who only needs to cook a little here and there, not huge meals. And yes everything has little waffle marks!
customer_reviews.author: Sherril ✌️💕🌞

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I try to avoid purchasing unitaskers but as of late my household waffle consumption has been upwards of $500 a year, so i thought it was about time. The product is very easy to clean, it's easy to assess it's cleanliness as well. This is important because none of the parts are removable. The highest setting cooks in five minutes or less and the lower settings for more.
customer_reviews.author: H̡̘Ú̹̜͇̳̬͈͎M͞A͔͔̩̦̹̻͓N̨͓̗̘̣ ̙̻̘̣̭̤̠̀#͎̟̫̯͇7̧̞̫̠5̯̼̖̬͓̹36̞̝͎9͉̣͚̜9̹6̟̻͉͚̭͎3͓ͅ

customer_reviews.title: MAKES DECENT WAFFLES...BUT STAY ON YOUR TOES!
customer_reviews.text: There is virtually nothing automatic about this device. You are advised to watch the steam produced by the cooking waffle, and quickly open the cover when the steam stops. So be prepared to pick your teeth or study your navel for several minutes while the steam rises. Then unplug the machine, open the cover and remove the goodies. When you've got the hang of it, the goodies are quite good. But this device has few features. Perhaps the best feature is the low price. If this is your principal concern, go for it!
customer_reviews.author: Edward Marcus

customer_reviews.title: !Desolate in ST Louis
customer_reviews.text: What a disappointment! It never even heated up at all! I already threw away the box (silly optimist!) so I can't return it. I expected better from Oster. Caroline
customer_reviews.author: carol

customer_reviews.title: I love my waffle iron
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I read some of the reviews before I bought it and I can't believe they weren't happy with this waffle iron. I try not to eat gluten so most of my recipes have no wheat flour. This iron heats up quickly, cooks great (so what if it doesn't have a timer!), the waffle FALLS out of the iron without spraying it or anything! I LOVE it. Once you finish, wipe it off with a damp cloth, flip it up on its hinge and it slides into a small space in the cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Cleans super easy. Easy to make perfect fluffy waffles!
customer_reviews.text: Both sides cooked evenly so I dont know what other reviewers did to theirs. I even bought a discounted used one and it is in perfect working condition. I plug it in, follow instructions, and boom! Perfect cooked waffles. I was worried the creators idea of "medium" and my idea of it would be way off so I turned the setting low first try. I'm cautious with new products now since my toaster thinks "medium" is "barely not black". Very happy waffles came out exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Bc

customer_reviews.title: Works good -fabulous no chemical ceramic
customer_reviews.text: My last one from this maker lasted years. I REALLY like the lack of non stick and the ceramic truly doesn't stick. The ready light is improving as it is used. At first it came on too quick and it wasn't cooked but it is getting better and better. Makes nice medium depth Belgium waffles. Our new family weekend breakfast.
customer_reviews.author: Redwood

customer_reviews.title: Good looking unit—but can the waffles get crunchy? We shall see...
customer_reviews.text: The jury is still out on this one. I like the look and the ease of use. HOWEVER, I put it on the darkest setting but it doesn’t get crunchy. You really need to give it longer to get to crunchy. I haven’t made it there yet because I only used it once and wasn’t able in that batch to get them right. They looked golden, but they were flimsy. I like crunchy, so will have to work at this more. Could be the batter too. My last Belgian waffle maker made them thick and crunchy so I’m hoping I’ll get the hang of this one.
customer_reviews.author: speedybee62

customer_reviews.title: Takes too long to cook the waffle
customer_reviews.text: I really liked how inexpensive this product is. It's MUCH cheaper than other waffle irons on Amazon. However, it does comes with some drawbacks. Even on the hottest setting, it takes 10-15 (or more) minutes to cook the waffle. Most waffle irons take half as much time. The good thing is that the non-stick function works well. I added a bit of butter to both sides of the iron before adding the batter and I had absolutely no issues removing the waffle. However, I do wish I spent a little more money and got a higher quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Lara Russell

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this
customer_reviews.text: I like that this is small and light and perfect for 1 serving but it comes out limp as a dish rag, terrible texture, not crispy no matter what I do. I have tried home made batter and commercial, different time frames, temp control and it is all the same. Not really Belgium waffles. They are thin not deep although they have big holes. I just reviewed the ads about it and it says Belgium like waffles. The other good thing is they don't stick. But I don't like it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Easy clean up
customer_reviews.text: So easy to clean! Love that you don't have to use any spray. Works best on medium/high heat. Waffles aren't as thick as waffles you would make at a hotel breakfast buffet but they are thicker than regular waffles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Foolproof Waffle Iron
customer_reviews.text: I am a pretty hopeless cook. I've been missing waffles for a long time now and someone at work recently made some outstanding vegan waffles using this iron. I got the recipe and, after much trepidation, bought the waffle iron. Much to my amazement, every batch I've made so far has been perfect and yummy! Even I haven't managed to mess it up. I set the temp to between the halfway mark and high, then set a timer for 4.5 minutes. I've been making a vegan oatmeal flour recipe and it's been a huge success.
customer_reviews.author: horse_sas

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it specifically for chaffles, but I've also made waffles in it. Heats up quickly, cooks evenly, barely have to clean it. What sold me on it intially is that it does not have the carcinogenic coating most do. But I am really glad I got it. Love it. So easy and quick to use. I do cook everything a bit longer though...but that is because I like crisp edges.
customer_reviews.author: 3rdCoastCC

customer_reviews.title: A quality item well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This waffle iron is really well made. I have not used it much but I expect it to be durable and it is an attractive little item to have on the breakfast table. My only criticism is that the waffles that it makes are small and they take a while to fully cook, so that slows our breakfast down. Fortunately, there are usually only two of us at breakfast, we solve the small waffle, slow cooking problem by serving each of us a half waffle at a time. Jim C.
customer_reviews.author: Mary E. Lane, M.D.

customer_reviews.title: Thank you Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I really want to thank you Amazon for sending me an obvious return --- which was dirty!. We pay for new items ---- NOT used !!!!! obviously returned and so far have not reordered this item.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Anderson

customer_reviews.title: The 'ceramic' coating is still a polymerized finish that has chemical-ceramic matrix. That isnt pure ceramic in my book.
customer_reviews.text: The 'ceramic' coating is still a polymerized finish that has ceramic particles, but is still a nonstick coating with chemicals. I gave it away. Construction is ok, I think it would probably last for years, just the 'ceramic' is a misnomer. They still use chemical binders in a ceramic base. I gave it away- for 20 bucks- not worth the time to return. I suspect there is a very good reason there are the 70-80 dollar units out there. All said and done- for 20 bucks you can make tons of waffles? hey if that is what you are looking for with a commercial nonstick coating- buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: capt jeff shattuck

customer_reviews.title: Get this, the best for less, and skip the rest
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for about 6 months and absolutely love it. Works perfectly, beautiful results, could not be easier to use and maintain. Love the new safe non-stick ceramic which releases waffles with ease. I have not one single complaint about this little gem of a kitchen wonder. Thanks, Oster, for hitting the sweet spot on waffle makers!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Worked great 5 times....
customer_reviews.text: It made great waffles about 5 times before the top heating element stopped working. Would have returned it but was out of town and missed the return window. I guess I got what I paid for.... :-(
customer_reviews.author: tanya masterson

customer_reviews.title: Darned good waffles
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a wonderful waffle maker. Heck, it would still be wonderful at 3x the price. It is easy to use, easy to clean and compact enough to store easily. The brief manual even solved my problem of non-crisp waffle (briefly cool on an elevated rack). The best $10 I have spent in awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great and stick resistant!!
customer_reviews.text: I can make waffles again. I had an old cast Iron 4 square waffle maker and it was sticking terribly even with greasing and I bought this to replace it. It is wonderful to just be able to pull a waffle out of it without the sticking mess. I do grease it, but that is out of habit and not because it necessarily needs it. Love it and so does my family.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff-n-Beth

customer_reviews.title: Perfect waffles every time
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. So glad I found a waffle maker that didn’t have the non stick coating that is so dangerous for my parrot to be around. Makes perfect waffles every time!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Perfect waffles
customer_reviews.text: We read the reviews and used the tips to makes perfect waffles. I think waiting for the steam to let up before opening is essential. Even gluten free waffles made with nut butter instead of oil came out perfect. Also quite easy to clean since the waffles didn't stick.
customer_reviews.author: J. ware

customer_reviews.title: Shallow soggy waffles
customer_reviews.text: I guess you get what you pay for at $19. The grid is quite shallow. As someone else described it, it creates an “indented pancake”. Also the waffles do not get crispy and that is not related to the batter. The last waffle maker I had was an Oster 1.5 inch flip version. It was great and so I just ordered the 1.5 inch $39 titanium Oster flip. Hopefully that will work like the old one.
customer_reviews.author: Mimithecat

customer_reviews.title: Cooks unevenly
customer_reviews.text: Like several other people noted, the top of the waffle maker doesn't cook nearly as well as the bottom half. Overall, its super cute, easy to use and clean, and compact (and I need that since I have a small kitchen). The top does cook, but the waffles are a lot lighter on the top vs the bottom. Sometimes I flip them, but don't usually have time. That's the only drawback.
customer_reviews.author: R.M. James

customer_reviews.title: Bought for Chaffles
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want a "mini" Waffle maker! his is an awesome Waffle maker! I an make Cahffles in less than 5 minutes! Pretty much when it stops steaming it is done. PLUS, no sticking!
customer_reviews.author: Malu Hammans

customer_reviews.title: Super quality!
customer_reviews.text: Wipes clean, heats evenly, high quality finish. Glad I bought this larger model than many use of a keto diet. A chaffle/waffle takes the same time to cook, and is easily divided in 2 or 4 pieces suitable to use for a sandwich or bun. Millions of recipe variations available. Compact for storing, but mine is used so often that it lives on the counter!
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Nims

customer_reviews.title: SMALL BUT MIGHTY
customer_reviews.text: Very inexpensive, but is the best waffle iron we have every had. NOTHING sticks to the ceramic surface. It is small, so it fits easily on counter next to toaster. So easy to use. We were making pancakes for kids before school, but now the batter always goes into this handy little waffle iron.
customer_reviews.author: pat thompson

customer_reviews.title: Best Waffle Maker I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Waffles are a breakfast tradition at our home. I have owned others but this is the best. The coating is really good. Nothing sticks. Waffles have come out perfect every time.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Great waffles and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This is a good little waffle maker, I gave it at 4 because it would be nice if the temperature control knob had a white line or something that was easier to see. Also, it doesn’t tell you when waffle is done, you just have to keep checking. But it does make great waffles! And super easy to clean!
customer_reviews.author: Lia

customer_reviews.title: It's not really a non stick surface
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty easy to use but very hard to clean, it said that it's ceramic non stick but you still have top use oil otherwise it will stick but the plates don't come off so it can't be cleaned in the sink rather you have to user a towel top try and brush off the oil and battery that sticks to it.
customer_reviews.author: David Wong

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Great compact waffle maker. Easy to clean, nothing sticks and it claims to be non toxic. I am happy with it. Now if I can just find a waffle recipe I like. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Gfamily

customer_reviews.title: Perfect waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a Ceramic coated waffle maker for a short time and when I saw this one on Amazon I ordered it. The delivery time was as noted. The waffle maker works flawlessly. I found a recipe for gluten free KETO waffles and I make them often. I'm completely satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: I Love Yorkies

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I have never made waffles in my life. But I finally came to the light and realized pancakes were not that good. So I bought this hoping to make waffles my standard for breakfast and it did not disappoint. My first usage wasn't the best but that was purely from human error. I was too conservative with the heat when I wanted to have golden brown waffles. Second time using was perfect. The waffled never stick. And clean up is non-existent. If I had to be nitpicky I'd say I'd want an auto-off feature in case I leave it on but at this price it really doesn't matter!
customer_reviews.author: B. D.

customer_reviews.title: Great fun easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Love this waffle maker. The instructions say you really need to experiment with your recipe but gives loose guidelines. Works great, with pancake mix you have to test out water ratio, mixing, heat and time but that’s why we wear big boy/girl pants when cooking with any appliance...
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: VERY NICE AND NOT TOXIC
customer_reviews.text: VERY EASY TO USE AND I LOVE THAT IT IS NOT TEFLON BUT IS CERAMIC. IT'S VERY HARD TO FIND APPLIANCES LIKE THIS THAT ARE NOT TEFLON.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: NICE WAFFLE MAKER
customer_reviews.text: Lucky to get this nonstick waffle maker for just $19 brand new in the box. I used this waffle maker for the first time today! I must say it works amazing. It is easy to use & clean too. Very simple is what I like. My waffles came out nice warm & fluffy. Look forward to making breakfast more often now!
customer_reviews.author: kima

customer_reviews.title: Weird taste
customer_reviews.text: I love that it doesn’t have toxic chemicals which was the most important buying need for me. Maybe I just haven’t used the right recipe yet but things just aren’t tasting quite right yet. It may also be that it is harder to make a crispy waffle with this.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Ian Malcolm

customer_reviews.title: Nice!!
customer_reviews.text: I gave 4 stars because my waffle is not crispy. I bought this waffle maker because I wanted crispy waffles but its not. Its to easy to clean and the mixture doesnt stick. Its to easy tu use and you can put the temperature that you want.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Like this waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with it as want to get away for Teflon, after watching a documentary about the hazards of Teflon, and our health.
customer_reviews.author: Jean B. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Buy this now!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is phenomenal. Forget about the ones that flip; they are weak and useless. This little beast heats evenly on both sides and cleans up easily with an outstanding no-stick surface. The hinges are strong so it stands up to whatever I stick in it; frozen mac and cheese, boneless chicken wings, whatever. If you can cram it it there it will turn it into a delicious waffle!
customer_reviews.author: heff

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap waffle maker.  Cooks fine with some warmup  time.
customer_reviews.text: Used this a handful of times now. Set it to high and give it time to warm up while you make the batter and you'll be good. Waffles come out perfect at first and then turn down the heat so you don't overly darken them. Other than that, it's a waffle maker and it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: J. GRAY

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT, Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean and use. I think my girls made every kind of waffle there is. Makes light and fluffy waffles. Great thing is it just takes a couple of minutes and you have delicious waffles. Clean up is a snap.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't make crispy waffles
customer_reviews.text: This iron works well and the non-stick coating is excellent, but I just could not get crispy waffles out of it. I tried different mixes, I tried extending the cooking time, they still came out soft and a bit rubbery. I'm guessing it just doesn't allow enough steam to escape while cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Rock Jock

customer_reviews.title: Makes perfect wafles.
customer_reviews.text: Makes perfect wafles without the need to flip! I have seen many other brands that flip or turn/spin and they all break or get jammed but this one is simple and functional.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Obvious

customer_reviews.title: Used
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I just received today. First thing I received late second, it looked open. Like someone had return and they didn’t even check if at least it looked un used. Third as soon as I open the box it had such a horrible smell.
customer_reviews.author: Gabby

customer_reviews.title: unevenly cooked
customer_reviews.text: I do love that it is so easy to clean. Wipe and done. I used Bisquik batter for my waffles due to time restrictions. The back cooked perfectly, while the front was still white and a little doughy. If and when I have time to make batter from scratch, I may change my review depending on the outcome.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Grandkids love papa waffles so I bought this to make them. Easy to use, clean and heats up quickly. Surfaces are very very hot so little fingers don’t belong there. The DuraCeramic has held up and since its made of oxygen and silicon no toxicity.
customer_reviews.author: DctR

customer_reviews.title: I cannot recomment it
customer_reviews.text: did not cook or brown waffles enough awkward to clean.cheaply made
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Healthy waffles
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Use health smart Bisquick, egg beaters, and store brand diet 7up instead of milk. Light and fluffy! Freezes well! Make in single batches.
customer_reviews.author: D.J.

customer_reviews.title: Indispensable little gadget.
customer_reviews.text: Get the book "Will It Waffle?" and find out what this little gem can do. I use it every day, and have yet to make waffles. Plus it's small enough to leave on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Dicksie Dudeney

customer_reviews.title: It didn't last over 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: We used this waffle maker about once a week for 2 years. It worked well and was easy to clean. The waffles never really came out crispy but it was good enough. A couple of weeks ago it stopped working. It won't heat up properly and then just stopped working all together. We are really bummed but I guess for $20 it was worth the buy. I think we will try another brand though.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Great worked fine on first try next update like in a month or 2
customer_reviews.text: The instruction booklet came with recipie and a little help from YouTube they where amazing ,and hubby loved it so much ..
customer_reviews.author: M.L

customer_reviews.title: Great waffle iron for medium-sized waffles!
customer_reviews.text: I took my time to review this waffle iron to make sure it was durable. I've been using it for quite some time and I really enjoy it! It's been a few months and it still is perfectly non-stick. The only thing I would warn possible buyers is that the waffle plates are medium sized, therefore, if you want to make gigantic waffles, this is not the product for you.
customer_reviews.author: JOSE ANTONIO DE SOUZA

customer_reviews.title: Love the Ceramic Coating!
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to find this waffle maker with a ceramic coating at a terrific price point! I was looking for specifically a waffle maker that was not coated with Teflon. I have been using this for quite a while now. It's reliable, cooks evenly and simple to use, very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Agee Bee

customer_reviews.title: Beware if buying as a surprise gift.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. We loved the huge waffles. Problem, they shipped it in the original box. Bought this for my wife and was going to surprise her. Caught the mailman before she got home. Problem averted. lol
customer_reviews.author: Thankuhal

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I've had the waffle maker since late June, use it regularly, and am very pleased with everything about it. I use it mainly to make chaffles (keto waffles made with egg and cheese).
customer_reviews.author: Karen Ballentine

customer_reviews.title: Hot inside and out
customer_reviews.text: Waffles are great and the non-stick works great. The design is lacking however. The outside of the unit gets very hot. Just take care and you should enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Small design issues that if
customer_reviews.text: Non stick surface is great but there are small nocks and crannies that trap the batter if these could be eliminated it would be 5 stars all the way. Also note these are large waffles
customer_reviews.author: Robert Minchella

customer_reviews.title: Not a real Belgium waffle maker. Missing screw
customer_reviews.text: This is not a Belgian waffle maker. Does not make crispy waffles no matter how high the temperature or how long I cooked it for. Really wanted this to be the one since it’s nontoxic. Also I think mine is missing some screw because it is very flimsy. Sadly will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Viktoriya Troshin

customer_reviews.title: Good Value!
customer_reviews.text: This is good for the price! Very easy to use and clean. Just pour in the batter once the ready light is on and wait about 4 minutes until it stops steaming. Comes out without sticking and a breeze to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Tam Tam

customer_reviews.title: AN OK WAFFLE MAKER
customer_reviews.text: This little waffle maker is perfect for one or two people. The only drawback is it doesn't get quite hot enough to create a very crisp waffe. They turn out more like hot cakes.
customer_reviews.author: G Harris

customer_reviews.title: Decent product
customer_reviews.text: I love that this doesn't stick! Makes crispy fluffy waffles with ease.
customer_reviews.author: katherine kurgan

customer_reviews.title: Did not work properly, did returned this kind
customer_reviews.text: Made several batches but none of them was done right, undercooked not done well at all. Returned this one and purchased different from manufacturer and it works fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I've only used it a few times, but quickly got the hang of it. I really thought I was going to have to grease the hell out of it, but it's really non-stick.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Ziegler

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t cook well.
customer_reviews.text: Very basic waffle iron. It doesn’t heat up too well and it mostly only heats up on the bottom. I’ve tried different batters and they all came out the same. The waffles never got crunchy, they were very soft and barely cooked. I had the heat up all the way and left them in there for about 10-15, flip them, and they were still awful. The only good things was it was easy to clean and the size isn’t too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Arellano

customer_reviews.title: the smaller size makes it easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a $60 Cuisinart Belgian waffle maker. When I first received this one I was worried it would be too small for my family of 5, but it cranks out waffles so quickly that no one really waits to eat. Plus, the smaller size makes it easy to clean. The best part is that I paid around $20. I did see it on sale for even less - about $15 or so. The test will be to see if it lasts as long as the old one. That one lasted 12 years.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE this waffle iron!
customer_reviews.text: This little beauty makes PERFECT waffles! We make paleo/gf waffles and my kids can't get enough of them. It is overall smaller than most waffle iron - which I LOVE - doesn't take up valuable real estate in my cabinets! Ceramic non stick works amazingly well. Waffles are as big as a dinner plate - perfect every time!
customer_reviews.author: Mom2Boyz

customer_reviews.title: Great waffles
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a waffle maker since childhood. This thing is awesome! Makes a perfect large waffle, and is non stick without need for oil. 4-5 min each bake time. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Great little waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use and makes great waffles, love it.
customer_reviews.author: Robinblythe

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one use
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this because so many people had glowing reviews, but after one use the “ready” light always stays on and it no longer heats up. Hopefully it never breaks on you because sticky, barely cooked batter is not as easy to clean (by a long shot) compared to baked waffles. Unfortunately I didn’t use this right away after purchasing, so it’s already out of it’s return window with Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle O.

customer_reviews.title: Bad purchase
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed. After 3 uses temperature that's stopped working. Took about 30-45 minutes to cook 1 waffle. Had to manually flip half way through.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good ceramic waffle maker!
customer_reviews.text: I like that it's a ceramic, and pretty easy to use but indicator light is not properly shows when the waffle is done...sad but still it's a good one. I did tried couple times and I'm pleased with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: YG

customer_reviews.title: waffle iron
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. Fast cleanup. Heats well for asmall unit. Perfect for one or two.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Pesterfield

customer_reviews.title: Not a Fan
customer_reviews.text: For a Belgian waffle, these are pretty thin - the unit is not deep enough. The ceramic is good for non stick but that is about all I like for this one. Glad it wasn't expensive. Use ample batter & it runs over - use less so it doesn't run over, it has holes in the the waffle. I've used others with much better results.
customer_reviews.author: eicy

customer_reviews.title: GREAT waffle iron!
customer_reviews.text: this one was a gift, i LOVE my waffle iron, i get crispy tasty waffles in 4 minutes tops. there are a thousand other things to do with your waffle iron besides waffles, try panini. hash browns. omlettes. google it!
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom, she loves it and so does my grandson because he likes for her to make waffles for him. It cooks great, doesn’t burn and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Latoisha Broussard

customer_reviews.title: Flat and soggy waffles
customer_reviews.text: We have had a few different waffle irons in the past 20 years. This one was not the worst, but it also was far from being good. On the highest setting it took over 7 minutes to produce a waffle. No matter how much batter we used or how long we cooked them, they never got crispy, especially around the edges. I would advise to spend more money to get a better quality waffle iron.
customer_reviews.author: Stephani Lortie

customer_reviews.title: Simple and just simply works
customer_reviews.text: I used some olive oil spray on it, nothing stuck. It is simple to use, I really like it a lot and plan to get a lot of use out of it. Unless it breaks fast (which I doubt it will), this is a five star purchase for me!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy in Florida

customer_reviews.title: But a good waffle mixture, it does make a difference.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great waffle maker for the price. I'm happy I decided to purchase it.
customer_reviews.author: Sulla W

customer_reviews.title: Nice little waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: This made some good looking waffles. It was a little tricky the first time because had to measure a bit more than we thought and keep checking to see how much the waffles were cooked - seemed like it took awhile, but overall we are happy with the purchase. Super easy clean up. Wipes out with a cloth in just a few seconds (we put blueberries in ours).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: Works great & cleans easily. Waffles come out perfect but take much longer to cook than the manual indicates.
customer_reviews.author: Wm.

customer_reviews.title: wonderful waffle  maker
customer_reviews.text: I love this appliance. temperature control is wonderful but it is a bit of a challenge to clean. Not a major fault though.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Kahler

customer_reviews.title: such a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I used this waffle at home to prepare Belgian waffles using the same product and recipe as I have always used before with my old waffle iron. But this new appliance did not produce anything like I expected. The waffle was soft on the outside no matter how long I cooked it. I prefer a crispy golden brown top. I didn't like the Belgian style as the surface didn't have deep enough ruts. Only thing good I can say is it was easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: low temp long cook
customer_reviews.text: just about what I paid for. Works and is easy to clean. Three stars cuz the temperature setting is off. Takes way longer to cook that what I thought.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compact and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: It's alright. I like that it is non-stick and easy to clean. The only thing is that the waffles seem to come out unevenly cooked. They come out darker in the middle and lighter on the outer part of the waffle, even when on the dark, or crispy, setting. Other than that, the waffles come out okay.
customer_reviews.author: Martin V.

product_meta.title: Oster Titanium Infused DuraCeramic Belgian Waffle Maker, Chrome (CKSTWF1502-TECO)
product_meta.description: Enjoy delectable, authentic Belgian-style waffles at home with the Oster Titanium Infused DuraCeramic Belgian Waffle Maker. This Belgian waffle maker is designed with a unique and innovative titanium-infused DuraCeramic nonstick coating that lasts eight times longer and cooks up to 30 percent faster than standard nonstick coatings. The safe and natural ceramic coating is PFOA- and PTFE-free, won't flake or peel, and wipes clean easily, so you can make waffles without worry. Adjustable temperature control lets you accurately set the cooking temperature to make light, fluffy waffles or crispy, golden ones. With its polished chrome housing, the Oster Titanium Infused DuraCeramic Belgian Waffle Maker features an elegant design to complement any kitchen décor.
feature_bullets: Belgian waffle maker with titanium-infused DuraCeramic nonstick coating lasts 8x longer than ordinary nonstick coatings
Natural, PTFE- and PFOA-free ceramic coating won't flake or peel and cleans easily
Cooks up to 30% faster to save time and energy
Adjustable temperature control lets you make light and fluffy or crispy waffles
Polished chrome housing for an elegant design

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,580 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
